titleStmt.title: The following categories are used in the present version of the corpus (based on MEG-C):

category.catDesc: a private or extrajudicial arrangement, esp. one of reconciliation
a statement made in writing, confirmed by oath and intended to be used as judicial proof
an arrangement between two or more persons as to a course of action
a document by which a lessee transferred the unexpired portion of his/her term to a third party, who assumed all the obligations of the original lessee
a document by which witnesses swear that the transaction recorded in the deed really occurred. The same label is also used for documents whereby witnesses swear that a transaction has NOT occurred.
the settlement of a dispute by an arbitrator
a private undertaking "to pay a specified sum of money by an appointed day" (Pugh 1947: li)
a document outlining the boundaries of a piece of land
a document by means of which one person commissions another for a particular piece of work
an agreement by the parties in a dispute to submit to arbitration by one or more named arbitrators
a document expressing a complaint
a condition added to an obligation
a document which records the judgement of a court
a formal statement or announcement
a document by the force of which a law is enacted
a document by which two parties exchange interests of supposedly equivalent value
a document that conveys an immediate title to a corporeal hereditament (land, houses etc.)
a document that conveys incorporeal hereditaments (intangible property)
a record of a formal inquest
the oath required by the practitioners of a particular profession or the people appointed to a particular post
a document by which a landlord conveys his/her property to a person for the duration of their life, or for a limited number of years. The lessee normally paid rent to the lessor
a document which sets out the intentions of the different parties to a planned marriage and the steps they will take to effect them
a document in which the terms of a transaction or contract are embodied; a formal note of something to be remembered
a formal declaration of a fact or a promise by invoking a deity or other authority as a witness to affirm the truth of the statement of a fact or a promise
a document that commits a person to carry out a payment or other action; a written contract or bond
an established set of principles or rules for a community or group
a document that effects a division into several shares of an estate held in co-ownership
a document presenting an ancestral line

a formal written request or supplication, appealing to an individual or group in authority (as a sovereign, legislature, administrative body, etc.) for some favour, right, or mercy, or in respect of a particular cause
document or clause appointing a person to act as another's representative in legal or business matters
document that guarantees the security of a contract, right or possession
a document by which a possession is terminated for the benefit of one who had previously enjoyed nothing but an expectancy
a document by which a vendor conveys his/her land to feoffees for the advantage of a third party
a document by which a person states how his/her property should be disposed of after his/her death
MINUTES
CHARTERS
DEPOSITIONS
CORRESPONDENCE
DIARIES/JOURNALS
CHRONICLES
CALENDAR
PLAYS
